snippet: The attack on a Kenyan university that killed almost 150 people exposed how powerless the country is in the face of a ruthless terrorist organization.
abstract: Survivors of massacre at Garissa University College in Kenya say Shabab militants easily killed 150 students by tricking them into voluntarily leaving their dorm rooms with promises of safety; recall militants ordering students to call their parents and tell them that attack is payback for Kenya's military intervention in Somalia.

byline.contributor: Rukmini Callimachi contributed reporting from New York, and Isma’il Kushkush from Nairobi.

lead_paragraph: The attack on a Kenyan university that killed almost 150 people exposed how powerless the country is in the face of a ruthless terrorist organization.

headline.main: Come Out and Live, Shabab Told Kenya Students. It Was a Lie.
headline.print_headline: Promised Mercy, Kenyan Students Got Bullets
